trans-unit.source: The Cloud Platform Integration Framework (CPIF) provides workload integration guidance for onboarding applications into a Microsoft Cloud Solution.
trans-unit.target: The Cloud Platform Integration Framework (CPIF) provides workload integration guidance for onboarding applications into a Microsoft Cloud Solution.

trans-unit.source: CPIF describes how organizations, customers and partners should design and deploy Cloud-targeted workloads utilizing the hybrid cloud platform and management capabilities of Azure, System Center and Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: CPIF Architecture
trans-unit.target: CPIF Architecture

trans-unit.source: Both public and private cloud environments provide common elements to support the running of complex workloads.
trans-unit.target: Both public and private cloud environments provide common elements to support the running of complex workloads.

trans-unit.source: While these architectures are relatively well understood in traditional on-premises physical and virtualized environments, the constructs found within the Microsoft Azure require additional planning to rationalize the infrastructure and platform capabilities found within public cloud environments.
trans-unit.target: While these architectures are relatively well understood in traditional on-premises physical and virtualized environments, the constructs found within the Microsoft Azure require additional planning to rationalize the infrastructure and platform capabilities found within public cloud environments.

trans-unit.source: To support the development of a hosted application or service in Azure, a series of patterns are required outlining the various components required to compose a given workload Solution.
trans-unit.target: To support the development of a hosted application or service in Azure, a series of patterns are required outlining the various components required to compose a given workload Solution.

trans-unit.source: These architectural patterns fall within the following categories:
trans-unit.target: These architectural patterns fall within the following categories:

trans-unit.source: **Infrastructure**– Microsoft Azure is an Infrastructure- and Platform-as-a-Service Solution which is comprised of several underlying services and capabilities.
trans-unit.target: **Infrastructure**– Microsoft Azure is an Infrastructure- and Platform-as-a-Service Solution which is comprised of several underlying services and capabilities.

trans-unit.source: These services largely can be decomposed into compute, storage and network services, however there are several capabilities which may fall outside of these definitions.
trans-unit.target: These services largely can be decomposed into compute, storage and network services, however there are several capabilities which may fall outside of these definitions.

trans-unit.source: Infrastructure patterns detail a given functional area of Microsoft Azure which is required to provide a given service to one or more Solutions hosted within a given Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Infrastructure patterns detail a given functional area of Microsoft Azure which is required to provide a given service to one or more Solutions hosted within a given Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: **Foundation** – When composing a multi-tiered application or service within Azure, several components must be used in combination to provide a suitable hosting environment.
trans-unit.target: **Foundation** – When composing a multi-tiered application or service within Azure, several components must be used in combination to provide a suitable hosting environment.

trans-unit.source: Foundation patterns compose one or more services from Microsoft Azure to support a given layer of functionality within an application.
trans-unit.target: Foundation patterns compose one or more services from Microsoft Azure to support a given layer of functionality within an application.

trans-unit.source: This may require the use of one or more components described in the infrastructure patterns outlined above.
trans-unit.target: This may require the use of one or more components described in the infrastructure patterns outlined above.

trans-unit.source: For example, the presentation layer of a multi-tier application requires compute, network and storage capabilities within Azure to become functional.
trans-unit.target: For example, the presentation layer of a multi-tier application requires compute, network and storage capabilities within Azure to become functional.

trans-unit.source: Foundation patterns are meant to be composed with other patterns as part of a given Solution.
trans-unit.target: Foundation patterns are meant to be composed with other patterns as part of a given Solution.

trans-unit.source: **Solution** – Solution patterns are composed of infrastructure and/or foundation patterns to represent an end application or service being developed.
trans-unit.target: **Solution** – Solution patterns are composed of infrastructure and/or foundation patterns to represent an end application or service being developed.

trans-unit.source: It is envisioned that complex solutions would not be developed independently of other patterns.
trans-unit.target: It is envisioned that complex solutions would not be developed independently of other patterns.

trans-unit.source: Rather, they should utilize the components and interfaces defined in each of the pattern categories outlined above.
trans-unit.target: Rather, they should utilize the components and interfaces defined in each of the pattern categories outlined above.
